title: >>> Saturday Night's MAIN EVENT
body_text:
Reminder:
John Tronolone, Diana DiBuccio, Chris Adams, Kevin Adams, Justin Pierce, Mike "Sputz", Tom Adams, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kevin Megill, and Steve Adams must attend
DODGEBALL 90
for their chance to become captain at
DODGEBALL 100
.
DODGEBALL 100
will be held on
Saturday, August 18
, emanating from Wall High School.
________________________________________
_________________________
Pierce, Adams at DODGEBALL 90!
JUSTIN PIERCE
The loud-mouthed court general headlines the biggest event of the year! For the first time in his illustrious career, Justin Pierce takes center stage at a classic season finale extravaganza. A mainstay since the sport's inception, the multi-time award winner has just about seen it all. From his long-standing rivalry with Diana DiBuccio to his game-saving rimshots time and time again, Justin has accomplished what many wish they could in a year-plus tenure as a dodgeball superstar. But as a captain, not much is known of the wily veteran.
DODGEBALL XXX4: April 7, 2006
Billed as
A Roll of the Dice
, the 34th dodgeball spectacular witnessed history in the making. A first for the sport, teams were divided via a random drawing, where competitors of all ages, sizes, and genders picked numbers "1" or "2" out of a hat. But unbeknownst to those in attendance, two special "captains" cards were also included in the drawing, one of which belonged to "The Piercer". Along with poster-making rival Dan Spengeman, the two became on-court team generals for the evening in what would be Pierce's only time in the captain's chair. Unlike their past poster wars behind the scenes, it was "QuickSand" Dan picking up the victory in an extremely close encounter. The final score read 4 to 3.
It's been over a since that fateful day and you can bet "The Piercer" will be going all out to make this 90th spectacular one unforgettable night. The fearless and respected icon has everything to gain heading into this milestone event.
......................................
TOM ADAMS
Arguably, the most athletically gifted all-star to ever compete in the game of dodgeball. One of four famed Adams brothers, Tom Adams rose above the ranks immediately following his debut at DODGEBALL 8. His rocket arm and pinpoint accuracy have earned him tremendous offensive success. Paired with his agile dodging ability, he has truly become one of the finest all-around talents the game has ever seen.
DODGEBALL 15: November 26, 2005
Regarded as one of the most team-spirited events ever recorded, Tom Adams defeated the multi-talented Kurt Gassner in Tom's tryout captains confrontation. It was only a prelude of things to come.
DODGEBALL 32: March 25, 2006
Riding on the success of his inaugural bout, Tom did it again, this time taking down legend Ryan McCrorey in a highly-competitive
Wet War
. It was another close call, but the third eldest Adams reigned supreme taking home the 6th and final game in this one.
DODGEBALL 50: August 4, 2006
With the introduction of the now-popular pregame
Rimshot Contest
, it was no secret Tom would do anything to become the contest’s first winner and more importantly, earn the opportunity to challenge youngest brother Kevin and a hand-picked partner on the grandest stage of them all. As fate would have it, Tom, who would pair up with older brother Chris, somehow, someway, managed to defeat eight other teams vying for the same position. Kevin, to no ones' surprise, would choose the brother that started it all, the charismatic Steve, as the team co-captain.
In the wet, wild, and unpredictable war, victories would trade back and forth throughout the four-hour melee. In the end however, Kevin and Steve would emerge as the winning Adams duo, handing their other brothers the first losses of their storied careers.
DODGEBALL 77: February 24, 2007
Off the heels of just the second "Slaughter Victory" one week prior, the self-proclaimed "Greek God" decimated female titan Lauren Winston, earning an astounding 11 games out of a possible 14. With this victory, Tom's unblemished singles record remained in tact.
Quite the list of fallen bodies Tom has put together. One must think, at least on paper, he is the solid favorite heading into DODGEBALL 90.
________________________________________
_________________________
The final preview coming up next!
Check back at the end of the week!
